item.description:
Every year the Yale symphony does a midnight Halloween concert which they describe as a "multimedia extravaganza involving a student-created silent movie [usually comedic], live-action scenes, smoke, & stunts." The performers are in costume, the audience is too, they'll play a score to the film, and other music, and I guess they do whatever crazy junk they've thought-up. And, for the guys, Alexis says one year a hot violinist played a solo in a bikini. Ok, that can be for the girls too, I don't judge.

You cannot buy tickets at the door for this, you must buy in advance, and it usually sells-out, so if you're interested...go buy now!

The cheapest way to buy is at the Shubert Box Office (no surcharges). Next cheapest is by calling Shubert Theater (203-562-5666) (some fees, less than online though). Or, buy online.

We WILL be in costume! :) Alexis & I will be at the Toad's Event before this. If you're not going to Toad's, we can still manage to meetup & sit together, just text or call me around 11-ish so that when I arrive at Woolsey (11:40?) I can tell you where I am or find out where you are. Though if you call, just leave a message, I probably won't attempt to answer the phone while in Toad's.

HOST: Jason, cell 203-901-4957

POST-PARTY: Nothing says Halloween like going to a diner in costume, and this might even happen.
item.name: Wed 10/31 - Midnight multi-media extravaganza at Yale
